mdRecord.dcterms:title: Fort Greene Park, general view
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Olmsted and Vaux (American landscape architects, 1866-1872) [work]
Wilson, Richard Guy [photographer]
mdRecord.dcterms:publisher: Rector and Visitors of the University of Virginia
mdRecord.dcterms:description: park originally named after the fort formerly located there, Fort Putnam, which itself was named for Rufus Putnam, George Washington's Chief of Engineers in the Revolutionary War. Renamed in 1812 for Nathanael Greene, a hero of the American Revolutionary War, it was redesigned by Frederick Law Olmsted and Calvert Vaux, who also designed Central Park and Prospect Park, in 1867. -- https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fort_Greene_Park [work]
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: Architecture and City Planning
